content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The chair is described as being brown and located on one of the sides of the room. In view 4, there is a brown chair clearly visible on the left side of the room. This view provides the clearest and most unobstructed view of the chair compared to the other views.

Here is the annotated image of the selected view. 
All objects belonging to the chair class is labeled by a unique number (ID) in red color on it.
Please select the object ID that best matches the given query description: "the chair is in one of the sides of the room. the color of the chair is brown.".
Carefully analyze the specified conditions (such as shape, color, relative position with surrounding objects) in the given query, then select top-5 best-matched object IDs.
The selected top-5 object IDs should be sorted in descending order of confidence.
The object ID should be chosen from this list [2, 4, 13, 16, 18, 21]
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified and ranked the top-5 target object IDs.
"object_id": A list of5 selected target object IDs. e.g., [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

The query specifies a brown chair located on one of the sides of the room. Analyzing the image, the chairs with IDs 18 and 21 are positioned along the left side of the room and appear to be brown. These are the most likely candidates. Chair ID 13 is at the bottom side of the room and also appears brown, making it a strong candidate. Chairs with IDs 2 and 4 are in the middle of the room and do not match the side location as well, but they are included for completeness. Chair ID 16 is not visible in the image, so it cannot be considered.
